analyzed: ci mi spyod ce na /

original: 'dod chags mi spyod /
analyzed: 'dod chags mi spyod /

original: zhe sdang mi spyod /
analyzed: zhe sdang mi spyod /

original: gti mug mi spyod /
analyzed: gti mug mi spyod /

analyzed: khyim pa'i rtags la sred pa mi spyod de /

analyzed: rab tu byung nas kyang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa mi 'dod cing /

analyzed: gang rab tu byung ba'i sgrub pa de la gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: de la rab tu byung ba'i sgrub pa gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'o //

analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa gang @8a *//
translated: What is the correct understanding of all phenomena just as they are?

original: zhe na; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: zhe na; rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: all phenomena are

analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams so; ;phung po lnga rab tu rtags pa ji ltar rab tu rtogs she na /

analyzed: phung po lnga rnams sgyu ma lta bu dang / dben pa dang / stong pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gag par rab tu rtogs pa ste /

analyzed: ji ltar rab tu rtogs pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ltar rab tu rtogs pa'o //

original: gang gi tshe yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /

analyzed: mi shes; rlom sems su mi byed /

analyzed: mi rtogs / rnam par mi rtogs pa de'i tshe rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni /

original: phung po rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //

original: gang phung po rab tu rtogs pa de; chos thams cad rab tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang phung po rab tu rtogs pa de; chos thams cad rab tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: The full understanding of the aggregates is the full understanding of all phenomena.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni / rab tu byung ba'i sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / rab tu byung ba'i sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the practice of going forth.

analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in this way

analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gcig po 'di dang ldan na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su sgrub pa'i chos kyi sgo 'di bshad pa na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdig bcom mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur te /

analyzed: 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags nyis stong gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //

analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye rgu'i srog chags khri bzhi stong ni /

analyzed: 'di ni / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gang gi tshe 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i chos nyid de /

analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs kyi 'od 'phro ba 'di lta ste /

analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu rnams byung ste /

analyzed: mi 'dul kha lo sgyur ba lung bstan gsol //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: dper na / da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par dga' ba na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa dang / nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' phun sum tshogs pa de 'dra bar bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab tu zhi zhing dul ba'i dbang phyug de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na yang de las mi lhag mi thu bar 'gyur
translated: just as the thus-gone one Akṣobhya’s buddha realm of Abhirati in the world system Abhirati is endowed with the array of the buddha realm’s qualities, the perfection of hearers, and the perfection of bodhisattvas, so too will the blessed thus-gone one, the worthy, perfect buddha Lord of Perfect Peace and Discipline’s buddha realm be endowed with those qualities, not more and not less.

analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la bstabs te tshim par byas so //
translated: Then, King Ajatashatru, knowing that the Blessed One and the assembly of monks were seated, personally served and satisfied the Tathagata and the assembly of monks with many excellent foods, drinks, and refreshments.

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas rgyal po ma skyes dgras bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / zhe sdang dang / 'chab pa gang nas 'byung ba lags /
translated: where do malice, harshness, anger, and deceit come from?

original: mi shes pa ci las skye ba lags /
analyzed: mi shes pa ci las skye ba lags /
translated: From what do ignorance and unknowing arise?

original: mi shes pa ji ltar 'gag pa lags /
analyzed: mi shes pa ji ltar 'gag pa lags /
translated: How does unknowing cease?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po ma skyes dgra la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po ma skyes dgra la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had thus asked his questions, the Blessed One said to King Ajātaśatru:

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great King,

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa yod pa las /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa yod pa las /
translated: From the existence of grasping at “I” and grasping at “mine”

original: gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / zhe sdang dang / 'chab pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / zhe sdang dang / 'chab pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: arise malice, hostility, anger, and concealment.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pas yon tan dang / nyes pa mi shes te /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pas yon tan dang / nyes pa mi shes te /
translated: Because of grasping at “I” and grasping at “mine,” one does not know the good qualities and faults.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called ignorance.

original: gang ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa de la ni /
analyzed: gang ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa de la ni /
translated: As for grasping at “I” and grasping at “mine,” if one knows them as they are in reality,

original: shes pa'am / mi shes pa zhes gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: shes pa'am / mi shes pa zhes gdags par mi nus so //
translated: one cannot designate them as “knowledge” or “ignorance.”

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rgyal po chen po /🔽khyod kyis 'du byed thams cad la gar yang 'gro @11a *//
analyzed: rgyal po chen po / khyod kyis 'du byed thams cad la gar yang 'gro @11a *//
translated: Great King,

original: ba dang / gang nas kyang 'ong bar mi gdags pa de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: ba dang / gang nas kyang 'ong bar mi gdags pa de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: you should train in such a way that you do not designate any conditioned things as going anywhere or coming from anywhere.

original: rgyal po chen po /🔽gang gar yang mi 'gro /🔽gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba de la chos gang yang 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po / gang gar yang mi 'gro / gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba de la chos gang yang 'gro ba'am /
translated: Great King,🔽that which does not go anywhere

original: 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: 'ong ba med do //
translated: and does not come from anywhere has no dharma that goes or comes.

original: gang la 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba med pa de la skye ba med 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: gang la 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba med pa de la skye ba med 'gag pa med de /
translated: That which has neither coming nor going has no arising and no ceasing.

original: gang mi skye mi 'gag pa de shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi skye mi 'gag pa de shes pa'o //
translated: That which neither arises nor ceases is cognition.

original: shes pa de ji lta bar mi shes pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa de ji lta bar mi shes pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as cognition is, so is non-cognition.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽nges par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / nges par 'byung ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: nges par mi 'byung ba'i chos de gang yang mi shes pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang gi tshe nges par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: nges par mi 'byung ba'i chos de gang yang mi shes pa'i phyir ro // gang gi tshe nges par 'byung ba'am /
translated: Because there is no dharma whatsoever that can be known as either emerging or not emerging.

original: nges par mi 'byung ba'i chos gang yang mi shes pa de'i tshe ye shes can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges par mi 'byung ba'i chos gang yang mi shes pa de'i tshe ye shes can zhes bya'o //
translated: When there is no dharma whatsoever that can be known as either emerging or not emerging, then one is called ‘one who has knowledge.’

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po ma skyes dgras 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po ma skyes dgras 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then King Ajātaśatru said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One,

original: ji tsam du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis legs par gsungs pa ngo mtshar to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ji tsam du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis legs par gsungs pa ngo mtshar to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: the well-spoken words of the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha are amazing.

original: gal te bdag par skabs 'di kho nar 'gum pa'i dus bgyid par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag par skabs 'di kho nar 'gum pa'i dus bgyid par gyur na ni /
translated: If I were to die at this very moment,

original: bdag nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: I would not be reborn in the intermediate state.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po ma skyes dgra la chos kyi gtam yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po ma skyes dgra la chos kyi gtam yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
translated: Then the Blessed One gave King Ajātaśatru a Dharma discourse,🔽encouraging him,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /🔽yang dag par rab tu dga' bar @11b mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs nas phyi dro'i dus kyi tshe yang chos kyi sbyin pa la 'du bar 'gyur ba mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar @11b mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs nas phyi dro'i dus kyi tshe yang chos kyi sbyin pa la 'du bar 'gyur ba mdzad do //
translated: exhilarating him, and delighting him.🔽Then he rose from his seat and departed. In the afternoon, he again gathered to give the gift of Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zas phyis len pa spangs te lhung bzed dang chos gos bzhag nas zhabs bkrus te nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i phyir gnas khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zas phyis len pa spangs te lhung bzed dang chos gos bzhag nas zhabs bkrus te nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i phyir gnas khang du gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having rejected the evening meal, put away his alms bowl and Dharma robes, washed his feet, and entered his dwelling for solitary meditation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyi dro'i dus kyi tshe nang du yang dag 'jog pa las bzhengs nas ri'i rgyal po bya rgod kyi phung po ga la ba der gshegs te byon nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyi dro'i dus kyi tshe nang du yang dag 'jog pa las bzhengs nas ri'i rgyal po bya rgod kyi phung po ga la ba der gshegs te byon nas 'di lta ste /
translated: Then, in the evening, the Blessed One rose from his meditative composure and went to Vulture Peak.

original: chos yang dag pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: chos yang dag pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
translated: When he arrived, he sat on the prepared seat in order to teach the Dharma correctly.🔽The venerable Śāriputra and the other great hearers also rose from their meditative composure, went to Vulture Peak and to where the Blessed One was, and having arrived, bowed their heads at the Blessed One’s feet, circumambulated him three times, and sat to one side.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / nyan thos chen po gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas ri'i rgyal po bya rgod kyi phung po ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te lan gsum bskor ba byas te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do; ;'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te lha'i bu bzhi
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / nyan thos chen po gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas ri'i rgyal po bya rgod kyi phung po ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te lan gsum bskor ba byas te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do; ;'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te lha'i bu bzhi
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta also rose from his meditative composure and went to Vulture Peak and to where the Blessed One was, together with four divine princes—

original: khri nyis stong thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa sha stag gis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar nas lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal🔽te phyogs gcig @12a *//
analyzed: khri nyis stong thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa sha stag gis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar nas lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig @12a *//
translated: All twelve thousand of them were completely dedicated to the Great Vehicle. They went together to where the Blessed One was staying, and when they arrived, they bowed their heads to the Blessed One’s feet

original: tu 'khod do //
analyzed: tu 'khod do //
translated: and sat to one side.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa yang byang chub sems dpa' stong tsam gyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar nas lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa yang byang chub sems dpa' stong tsam gyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar nas lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te
translated: The bodhisattva great being Maitreya, surrounded and attended upon by a retinue of about a thousand bodhisattvas, went together to where the Blessed One was staying, and when he arrived, he bowed his head to the Blessed One’s feet

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: and sat to one side.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sengge'i rtsal gyis mngon par bsgrags pa'i sgra yang byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya tsam gyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar nas lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sengge'i rtsal gyis mngon par bsgrags pa'i sgra yang byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya tsam gyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar nas lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Siṃha­vikrānta­gāmin, surrounded and honored by about five hundred bodhisattvas, went to where the Bhagavān was.

analyzed: zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head at the Bhagavān’s feet and sat to one side.🔽King Ajātaśatru, surrounded and honored by the four divisions of his army, went to where the Bhagavān was on Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgra yang dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar nas lhan cig tu ri'i rgyal po bya rgod kyi phung po ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgra yang dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar nas lhan cig tu ri'i rgyal po bya rgod kyi phung po ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head at the Bhagavān’s feet and sat to one side.

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen po nas kyang srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma ri'i rgyal po bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag @12b 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen po nas kyang srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma ri'i rgyal po bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag @12b 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: and many hundreds of thousands of living beings from the great city of Rājagṛha went to the Vulture Peak, to the place where the Blessed One was staying, and having arrived, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat down to one side.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus tshe ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu stan las langs nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus tshe ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu stan las langs nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the venerable Śāriputra rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Bowing to the Blessed One with palms joined, he asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen po'i grong bar du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sdig bcom gyis gang 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa las brtsams te yongs su zhus pa de'i
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen po'i grong bar du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sdig bcom gyis gang 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa las brtsams te yongs su zhus pa de'i
translated: In the middle of the great city of Rājagṛha, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Destroyer of Evil has asked about the array of qualities of the buddha realms of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: lan bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo tsam zhig bka' stsal na /
analyzed: lan bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo tsam zhig bka' stsal na /
translated: The Blessed One has given a brief answer to that question.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis da yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su 'grub pa de las brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis da yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su 'grub pa de las brtsams te /
translated: Now, Blessed One, please teach the bodhisattva mahāsattvas the accomplishment of the array of qualities of the buddha realms.

original: ji ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyi sde rnams pham par bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyi sde rnams pham par bgyid pa dang /
translated: How should bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice to be irreversible from unsurpassed and perfect awakening, to attain omniscience, to defeat the hordes of Māra,

original: gzhan mu stegs can rnams tshar gcod par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa zil gyis non par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su sbyong @13a *//
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can rnams tshar gcod par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa zil gyis non par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su sbyong @13a *//
translated: to defeat the non-Buddhists; to overcome the afflictions; to purify the array of qualities of a buddha realm;

original: bar 'gyur ba dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / shes rab yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bar 'gyur ba dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / shes rab yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: to fulfill aspirations; to not lose wisdom; to enter the buddha stage; to abandon the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha stages;

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob ste byang chub sems dpar gyur bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can dpag tu ma mchis /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob ste byang chub sems dpar gyur bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can dpag tu ma mchis /
translated: to practice the six perfections; to turn the wheel of the Dharma while being a bodhisattva and not yet attaining omniscience; and to benefit countless, innumerable sentient beings.

original: grangs ma mchis pa'i don bgyid par 'gyur ba de ltar chos legs par rab tu bstan du gsol /
analyzed: grangs ma mchis pa'i don bgyid par 'gyur ba de ltar chos legs par rab tu bstan du gsol /
translated: Please teach the Dharma well.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'khor 'di na rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo byang chub don du gnyer pa 'dus shing mchis pa rnams bcom ldan 'das las chos mngon sum du thos nas dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor 'di na rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo byang chub don du gnyer pa 'dus shing mchis pa rnams bcom ldan 'das las chos mngon sum du thos nas dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po thob par 'gyur te /
translated: in this assembly are gathered sons and daughters of good family who are intent on awakening. Having heard the Dharma directly from the Blessed One, they will attain vast joy and supreme joy.

original: de dag dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba thob nas ji ltar thos pa bzhin du nan tan gyis bsgrub par 'gyur ba dag mchis so //
analyzed: de dag dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba thob nas ji ltar thos pa bzhin du nan tan gyis bsgrub par 'gyur ba dag mchis so //
translated: Having attained joy and supreme joy, they will practice in accordance with what they have heard.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /🔽'di lta bu'i chos bstan par byas na 'khor 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te / 'di lta bu'i chos bstan par byas na 'khor 'di lta bu ni /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: mi mdzes kyi /
analyzed: mi mdzes kyi /
translated: “If I were to teach the Dharma in this way, this assembly would not be beautiful.

original: ngas ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byas pas phyogs bcu kun tu phyogs re rer yang 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bkye la /
analyzed: ngas ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byas pas phyogs bcu kun tu phyogs re rer yang 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bkye la /
translated: Therefore, I will perform a miracle such that in all ten directions, in each direction, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of light rays will shine forth.

original: 'od zer re @13b res kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po snang bas khyab par byas te /
analyzed: 'od zer re @13b res kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po snang bas khyab par byas te /
translated: Each of the light rays pervades with light many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddha realms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od kyang mi snang zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od kyang mi snang zhing /
translated: In those buddha realms, the light of the sun and moon does not appear.

original: de dag 'od zer de dag gis zil gyis mnan nas phyir mig gi dbang po la snang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lha rnams kyi 'od kyang mi mngon /
analyzed: de dag 'od zer de dag gis zil gyis mnan nas phyir mig gi dbang po la snang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lha rnams kyi 'od kyang mi mngon /
translated: Those light rays outshine them and do not appear to the eye faculty, and the light of the devas does not appear.

original: klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / nor bu dang / glog dang / me dang / skar ma'i gzugs dang / sems can gzhan gang gi 'od kyang mi mngon par 'gyur ba dang / gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa'i khor yug gang /
analyzed: klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / nor bu dang / glog dang / me dang / skar ma'i gzugs dang / sems can gzhan gang gi 'od kyang mi mngon par 'gyur ba dang / gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa'i khor yug gang /
translated: The light of nāgas, yakṣas, jewels, lightning, fire, stars, and the light of other beings does not appear, and the light of the surrounding Cakravāḍa mountains in the endless, limitless world systems in the ten directions does not appear.

original: khor yug chen po dang / btang bzung dang / btang bzung chen po dang / ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang / de ma yin pa gzhan ri'i rgyal po nag po dag dang / de ma yin pa gzhan ri nag po dag dang / rtsig pa dang /
